Posts.Content: Hi littlesusie just checked my first hospital app when I had mammogram and biopsy it was the 6th June, it definately has been a year I would not like to repeat, Ali glad things are on the up, sure you will enjoy Portugal, and put this all behind you xxxxxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: good luck today AliG sending love and hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Evening Ali, had 5th rad today, met up with Susie who was having her 2nd, won't be long before you start yours, hope you are ok, this has been a been a long year for many of us, but we are finally nearing the end, good luck to all having treatment, love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Well done Susie, what an achievement,  isn't it funny that little milestones mean such a lot , a year ago neither of us would have thought twice about going for long walks, what a difference a year makes, I managed to walk to pick my Grandaughter up  from nursery today, onwards and upwards. Love and hugs to everyone, there is light at the end of the tunnel, xxxxx
Posts.Title: A big step today

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, yes doing well, hope you are too xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, yes doing well, hope you are too xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Ali  i am on oral chemo, I have secondary breast cancer, I have been on palbociclib tablets and faslodex injections for 7 months so far and they are bringing my tumour markers down nicely, and the side effects are much gentler . love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Oral chemo

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Ali, hope you had a good day . Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Ali, hope you had a good day . Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Ali  i am on oral chemo, I have secondary breast cancer, I have been on palbociclib tablets and faslodex injections for 7 months so far and they are bringing my tumour markers down nicely, and the side effects are much gentler . love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Oral chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Judith,  My oncologist was going to put me on capecitabine, but then decided that he would try palbociclib, he did mention that the side effects would be about the same, but I have been lucky so far I have got the extreme tiredness and constipation but that’s it, like you I have had 7 cycles of it, 3 weeks on 1 week off. I hope your side effects lesson . I am on chemo for the rest of my life too. Take care love and hugs  Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Oral chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Judith,  My oncologist was going to put me on capecitabine, but then decided that he would try palbociclib, he did mention that the side effects would be about the same, but I have been lucky so far I have got the extreme tiredness and constipation but that’s it, like you I have had 7 cycles of it, 3 weeks on 1 week off. I hope your side effects lesson . I am on chemo for the rest of my life too. Take care love and hugs  Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Oral chemo

Posts.Content: Congratulations on finishing your chemo, love and hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: Brilliant news, enjoy your day at crufts, love the picture too Judith. How are you feeling Ali xx
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, I start using difflam on the day of my chemo and for the next 2 weeks, but it makes no difference I still get ulcers, it's a nightmare especially when I want to enjoy my Christmas lunch xx
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Congratulations Ali, one massive hurdle done, hope the side effects are not too bad, but at least you know this is the last time, well done, xxxxx
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: morning lovely ladies, need some help, a week after each fec I get the most awful mouth ulcers, I use the mouthwash and gel they give me, also have been given nystatin, none of which work, tried variious remedies from chemist , but nothing seems to help, they always come back in the same spot and last about 10 days, they are so painful they wake me up in the night, any help would be great, thanks good luck to all having chemo today xxxx
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Hi, my toes were like that , and my finger nails too, I couldn't bear to touch them, but it will eventually go away, usually after you finish chemo xxx
Posts.Title: Bruised Toe Nails

Posts.Content: Well done ladies, lovely picture, enjoy your bbq you have earnt it xxxxx
Posts.Title: Race for Life done and dusted ....

Posts.Content: Hi I have been given difflam mouthwash , and that's has no effect, will try strepsils, just want to be able to enjoy my chritmas lunch, thanks Mary xxx
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Thanks George, have been using manuka honey, but will get the stronger one xxx
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Good luck to you both for you final chemos it been along road but the end is in sight, Littlesusie and I both finish next week too, cant wait, good luck to all those starting chemo, love and hugs to you all xxxx
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: That's brilliant Susie, can't wait to be able to taste my food again, it's coming back but very slowly, looking forwrd to hopefully seeing you tomorrow  at the hospital xxx
Posts.Title: Happiness is .......

Posts.Content: Hi I use Dove pure roll on and have had no problems xx
Posts.Title: Chemo and deodorant

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, i have 2 more fec to have and then I go on to weekly taxol, I have had really bad headaches and felt really unwell on fec, just wondered if anyone knows if it will be the same on taxol, thanks lovely ladies xxx
Posts.Title: Weekly taxol side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies, was a bit worried as its every week and thought may be I would still feel ill when I had the next one, as long as I don't get these awful headaches I can cope, love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Weekly taxol side effects

Posts.Content: Hi ali, I was told not to use perfume ones too, xx
Posts.Title: Chemo and deodorant

Posts.Content: Thanks I have to have 12 weekly taxol, so was dreading it, but hopefully it won't be too bad, but every one is one step nearer the end, xx
Posts.Title: Weekly taxol side effects

Posts.Content: I might not make this one, it’s my daughters birthday on the 30th, she hasn’t made plans yet, so will probably find out later, would love to come though If I can xx
Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: LondonLass 6th is fine by me xxx
Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies, I don't even run for a bus either. xxx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD MUM

Posts.Content: That's lovely Allison, we are very lucky to have such wonderful kids xx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD MUM

Posts.Content: Hi, I had 4fec and on my 10th taxol, had no really bad side effects had a rash but they treated that, as for eating you just have to go by what you fancy as nothing tastes great, my appetite changed from week to week, one week I could eat one thing the next week I coulnt, drink plenty, hope you get on ok with your taxol, let me know if the diet works for you, good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Taxol & Peripheral Neuropathy - check this out!

Posts.Content: Morning lovely ladies, thought I would share this with you, just found out my daughter is running her first half marathon in aid of breast cancer, what she wrote on her sponsor page bought tears to my eyes, I am so proud of her, she is 41 and a single mum, and has had a really tough time lately and having to deal with me having breast cancer as well, this is what she wrote :- "Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I only started running in July 2014, something I never thought I could do. A half marathon seemed liked a good place to start!! Around the same time my mum was diagnosed with breast cancer so I'm aiming to raise some money to help fight this evil disease which seems to unfortunately touch so many of our lives. I'm running to encourage my mum that anything is possible and she will fight this and be fit, happy and healthy again with all of our support. Anything you can donate is greatly appreciated. " Thanks for taking the time to read this, she has made me very proud, xxxxx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD MUM

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, been for chemo today and the Dr has given me steroids and steroid cream to use as well as the antihistamine so hoping this will work, might be worth ringing the hospital and see if they can help. Xxxx
Posts.Title: The Royal Marsden Cancer Cookbook

Posts.Content: Hi susie, I have an appointment with the prof the week after, one day we will finally be there at the same time !! You have a busy week then, with the look good feel good session on Tuesday, let me know how you get on, hope you enjoy it as much as I did xxxx
Posts.Title: The Royal Marsden Cancer Cookbook

Posts.Content: Welcome Salswife welcome to the site no one wants to join, but one where you will find all the help you need,  the waiting is the worst, but on here you can talk to us as we have all been there, there is always someone around day and night, we are a friendly bunch , some with a wealth of information, but we all listen , there is plenty of support, laughs hugs and you can moan, rant, cry whatever you like we are all here with you. stay strong, you and your wife will get lots of support on here. love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Bombshell day

Posts.Content: So pleased for you, have a wonderful Christmas xxx
Posts.Title: Yeeeaaaah - Yippeee Christmas Came Early!

Posts.Content: This never crossed my mind either, my dog had her boosters while I was on chemo and I was fine, but she is due her kennel cough in March before she goes in kennels in April, I am on chemo for life so don’t know what to do, think a chat with my oncologist is in order, thanks for the heads up on this xx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well, I am a little bit cautious as I am on chemo for life, I have 3 weeks of tablets and a week off, just finished 16 months, it was recommended that I had the flu jab and I did but it put me in hospital, apparently the over 65 one had something new added to it. I am seeing my oncologist tomorrow so will talk to him again.  Think as you say it needs to be raised with Macmillan so we can be more clear about it.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: Thinks it’s just kennel cough because it’s a live virus and is sprayed up the Pets nose maybe it’s just some vets and the makers covering themselves
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: Spoke to my vet today and he hadn’t heard anything about it, but rang the makers and they said they did not recommend kennel cough for your dog if you are on chemo or have a compromised immune system, they said if I did insist I would need to sign a disclaimer, that’s if the vet would do it. They also said it can take up to six months for the dog to be free of the vaccine. They said it is definitely a live vaccine.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: Just got back from seeing my oncologist who is a top professor  and told him what the vet said, he did some research and said he could see no reason why my dog couldn’t have the kennel cough vaccine, so will book her in. While I was waiting to see him I was speaking to lady whose dog was given kennel cough vaccine while she was on chemo, and no ill effects, she had never heard of it either x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and my dog

Posts.Content: You and me both. Just finished my 10th course of chemo off to see oncologist tues, hopefully he will have the results of my scans, and then onto next lot of chemo. What a joy !!!!! love and hugs Jenny x
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: that is such a beautiful thing to do, it will make a little girl very happy xxxx
Posts.Title: Hair cut

Posts.Content: Same to you all too, love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Hello all my lovely friends

Posts.Content: Oh ali owl so sorry to hear your devastating news, it’s true what they say it’s the gift that keeps on giving, that no one wants. Just don’t know what to say just gobsmacked, you can beat this, we can do it together. Love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, sorry to hear you are feeling rough, what a lovely surprise, flowers brighten any day. Xxx
Posts.Title: Just had a nice surprise

Posts.Content: Hi, for me it is snuggled up with my dog , watching strictly after spending 6 days in hospital. Xxx
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Hi I have been using a simple baby shampoo, my hair is just starting to grow back and thought this might be the gentlest, and not irritate my scalp, xxx
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Glad you are feeling good I had my 3rd fec and apart from a sore mouth I felt good, in fact I am going christmas shopping today, can't be bad. My grandkids tell me Paddington is awesome so enjoy, I love kids films too . Have a good day all you lovely ladies xx
Posts.Title: What a different experience this time

Posts.Content: What a brilliant landmark, can't wait to finish mine, I never realised how ill it would make me feel, but like you the support on here is so fantastic, you never are alone, even in the middle of the night, thanks ladies xx
Posts.Title: Finished Chemo !!!

Posts.Content: Morning ladies, just got a phonecall to say they will fit my portacath next wed before my chemo on Friday, can't express how glad I am, after 3 fec my arm is so sore and because I had lymph nodes removed they could only use one arm, the veins have collapsed, although they had to use my other arm last time as they could not get a vein in my good arm, but that caused a lot of swelling round my scar. Can't understand why they don't automatically fit something before every one has chemo I don't know, what do you think ladies xxxx
Posts.Title: Finally getting my portacath fitted yeah xxx

Posts.Content: hi Susie, doesnt it feel great to do normal things, had a great time shopping, but did tire me out but was well worth it, even had lunch out, bonus. Hoping my 4th fec will be as good then will be able to enjoy chritmas, hope yours will be too, happy days ladies xxx
Posts.Title: What a different experience this time

Posts.Content: Hi Anne,I am very lucky it is not costing me anything , but I agree they should be fitted to patients having chemo, would save a lot of time trying to find veins xxxx
Posts.Title: Finally getting my portacath fitted yeah xxx

Posts.Content: i am on my 2nd fec chemo, and both times I have suffered with itchy hands and feet, any ideas what to use, only lasts a few days but drives me mad, love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Itchy hands and feet

Posts.Content: Hi susie, think Kathy is at coventry too if I have got it right,  xx
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Thanks Maggie, it was a lovely day, and all the little girls looks so lovely, ans my grandson did us proud x
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Hi kathy, when you go for your planning, you get your scan, tattoos and they talk you through what is going to happen,then they will give you a blue card with your first appointment on, usually about 3weeks time, as they say it takes this long to plan it., think you may get free parking, just hand your ticket to the desk on the way out and they stamp it, then you can just use it at the exit barrier, mind you you have to find a parking space first, it does not work for pay and display though, will say that the radiotherapy staff I had were lovely, think susies were too, and they keep an eye on you, and will send you to the nurse for all your creams etc, if you get really sore, good luck, love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx results ...

Posts.Content: hi all you lovely people, things are finally getting back to normal, still got aches and pains but starting to feel more human again, had lovely meal at my eldest daughters yesterday, one of my grandsons had his first holy communion this morning, and lovely party afterwards, and tomorrow my youngest grandson is celebrating his 1st birthday so partying all round, it is so lovely to be able to enjoy them all, and to top off the week start rads on Tuesday, the end is in sight, not been easy but doable, so to all you stating chemo good luck, you can do this. Love and hugs to you all xx
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Hi  Susie and Ali, finally  got my look good feel good session through its the 3rd of February, really looking forward to it. hope you are both feeling better, sending you both big hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, got to be at the Arden centre for 1.45pm, session lasts for 2hrs xxx
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Totally agree Susie, he is brilliant, and he has a gorgeous registrar xx
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Hi Phillipa6 I too had terrible indigestion while I was on tamoxifen, I took lanzoprasole and also gaviston highest dose of both, did help a bit, but as soon as I was taken off tamoxifen it disappeared, I am now having chemo once again but hardly any trouble with indigestion, you could talk to your oncologist and mention it they might change your lansoprazole for something else. Hope you get it sorted. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and indigestion.

Posts.Content: Hi Ali and Susie, sorry you both are having a rough time, sending a big hug to you both xxxx
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Thanks will try them,  xxx
Posts.Title: Itchy hands and feet

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well with your appointment, when they first told me I had to have chemo, I was shattered thought I would be just having rads, but then said to myself if that's what it takes then go and kick cancers butt, there were bad days but I kept saying each day is one day nearer the finish, I have an amazing husband, 3 wonderful daughters, and 7 gorgeous Granchildren who have been my reason to get up each day, they have been great all through, so go girl and kick cancers butt, sending love and hugs x
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Hi Georgie.  There are lots of free hat patterns on google, if you search for them, that’s what I did. Good luck, look forward to seeing the finished hat. Love and hugs Jenny xx Try this link x https://www.allfreeknitting.com/Knit-Hats/31-Knit-Hat-Patterns-for-the-Winter
Posts.Title: Crafts and bc

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief, will check my freezer. jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Frozen Vegetables Recall - Possible Listeria Risk (info for those...

Posts.Content: Hi bonbon, you need to talk to your breast care nurse and see if they do them at your hospital and get her to book you in, they are supposed to be great, and of course the bonus of a goodie bag too xxx
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: just like to share this with you, last June when I was diagnosed with breast cancer my 41year old daughter decided to take up running, and today she ran her first half marathon in Coventry she ran in aid of breast cancer, and has raised £400, I am so proud of her, and all for a brilliant cause xxx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD OF MY DAUGHTER

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies, hope everyone is feeling ok today, good luck to all having chemo today, together we will beat this xxxx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD OF MY DAUGHTER

Posts.Content: Wow you have been busy, chemo really knocked me about for 2weeks most times, but have managed meals out with friends on the third weeks, but that's about it, you seem to have been very lucky, did manage some Christmas shopping, and managed to celebrate 4 of my grandchildren birthdays so I suppose haven't done too bad, hoping my 12weekly taxol will be better. Xx
Posts.Title: Forward planning (or is this tempting fate?)

Posts.Content: Brilliant idea, give you something to look forward to, we had planned a cruise but had to cancel due to op, so we are planning to be on the 1st June criuse, I should finish same time as you so we can both celebrate in style xxxx
Posts.Title: Forward planning (or is this tempting fate?)

Posts.Content: Good morning I had the same trouble my good arm is so sore and they had trouble getting a vein, but my oncologist said it was fine to use the arm that had all the lymph nodes removed which they did and it was fine, he said they will now fit a portacath, but still waiting, talk to your oncologist or breast care nurse, hope all goes ok xx
Posts.Title: Help ..... my veins are giving up !

Posts.Content: Hi, your hair looks lovely, mine is just growing now and all shades of grey, not very long but I have given up wearing my wig when it started to grow, got a few funny looks when I was out, but thought this is me, if they don't like it, don't look. I hated wearing my wig and only wore it occasionly when I went out, never in the house, now I feel great and love that I can go without out. Love and hugs x
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: t thanks sending one back to you xxx
Posts.Title: A HUG....

Posts.Content: For some reason they have disappeared will try again later, keeps saying file too large xxx Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Sounds like a really lovely day violetsniff, my walking today was doing the school run for my grandchildren, then sitting on my garden swing reading, making the most of the sunshine. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Managed to catch some of the funeral of Billy Graham https://memorial.billygraham.org/live-stream/ yesterday “Billy Graham walk back to happiness “too xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies, not posted for a while as haven’t been able to walk very far, but managed a lovely walk with the dog to the local park, and saw this lovely old tree in full blossom. Loving all the photos, hopefully be able to do a bit more walking now. Love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely pictures ladies, gradually building my walks up, had a friend up from London to stay for a few days, so had a lovely walk and managed nearly 9,000 steps, really enjoying the lovely weather makes the walks so much nicer. On the subject of shoes I have karrimor boots and shoes and they are so comfortable and they are always on offer at a shop called sports direct, you can pick up some real bargains. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening ladies, hope everyone managed some lovely walks, had a lovely walk which is just behind the hospital, it circles it and it is covered with lots of lovely trees full of blossom making a lovely smell as you walk along the side of the river. Managed to walk a bit further today, so was really pleased. Couple of pics of my walk.  Love Jenny xx Well you will have to use your imagination can’t upload once again xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Dreamfhief can see your picture, but have tried on iPhone and iPad and still won’t let me. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What a beautiful picture Ronstar,  afraid nothing  as lovely on my walk, took the dog and grandkids for a walk in the woods, I could have done with a scooter to keep up with them and the dog. Enjoy the rest of your day ladies, the sun has finally come out here. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely pics ladies, not much walking for me today, but did manage a short dog walk. Daughters took me to see ” Annie the Musical.” Absolutely brilliant. Love Jennyxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What lovely pictures ladies, managed a bit longer walk today, not too far from where I live, afraid not as lovely as the places you have all posted, but I am walking, and hope to get a bit further afield soon. keep posting the pics they brighten up my day. Love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Judith, I can’t upload photos on my iPad or iPhone, it seems to happening far too often now, let’s hope they sort it soon, have contacted Macmillan so will wait and see, not holding my breath though. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Well managed one more, oh and another. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks Imelda, hope you have a lovely time, it is rather hot I try and keep out of it if I can. I am on oral chemo and they are taking their toll in this heat, managed a short walk this morning, but flagging now. Hope all goes well with number three. Same goes for me if you need anything. love Jenny x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I can’t seem to upload photos either, will try again later, enjoy the sunshine ladies x Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief, Tried reducing the size to the smallest size I could on my iPad and still does not work, going to give up now. jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely pictures ladies, had a lovely walk today with the dog, around the local park. sun is shining, but rather windy, Still not able to upload photos, will be out walking again later to pick grandchildren from school.xx Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief, let’s hope they sort it soon. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Well ladies, not much walking today, just a walk round Tesco, and then a lovely lunch with Bustysuzy ( Sue) and Mumra (Kathy ) and hubbies. Plenty of laughs. Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear about your car Ronstar, there are some horrible people about. Lovely pics again ladies, still can’t manage to upload any, had a lovely long walk in the woods with my dog and the grandchildren, stopping to play pooh sticks on the bridge, which they love, took lots of photos but you will have to use your imagination !!!! love and hugs Jenny.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning ladies, love the pic of the swan, here are some of the pics from my walks, let’s hope mine load.     Yeah it worked, love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Photos of my walk yesterday, hoping they will load this time. Walked early this morning so I could watch the Royal Wedding. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, well not a very exciting walk today, just walked to  hospital for bloods, then did the school run to fetch the granchildren, but managed over 8000 steps so every little bit helps. Love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning Imelda, you get to the walk at the entrance of the hospital, it is just on the right As you go in before the first island it is called the sowe valley walk, it does go as far as the binley fire station or coombe, but we normally walk to where it goes behind Tesco, it also goes the other way below b & m all the way to wyken croft, it’s a lovely walk, we go one way or another most days. Looking forward to seeing you too. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Afternoon everyone, haven't done much walking lately it’s been too hot and joints have been playing up, off for bone scan next week to see what’s happening. Today we had a lovely afternoon tea at Stoneleigh Abbey, and then a lovely walk around the grounds. Love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What lovely pictures leolady what a lovely place xx jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Haven’t been on for a while chemo has really knocked me out this month, my get up and go has gone, managed a short walk with the dog today, she insisted on trying to pick up the biggest branches she could find to carry home, took me ages. Love and hugs to you all Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Well managd to upload one, but won’t let me do any more. Jenny x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Violetsniff Is it handle of a pair of scissors xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening lovely ladies, loving all these pictures, I am still managing to walk most days, today we decided to go to the NEC, and have a look round Resorts World. Walking from the station we came across this lovely lake so thought I would take a few pics. Managed nearly 10,000 steps today too, so well pleased.  Keep walking ladies. love and hugs Jenny xx You will have to use your imagination as pics won’t upload once again xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies, Just been reading through this wonderful thread, and all the fabulous pictures, wish I lived near some of them, would love to be able to walk along the beach. well you have inspired me to get my walking boots out and go for a walk with the dog, and intended to do a gentle 20 mins, but ended up walking for 40 mins, very pleased with myself. Thankyou ladies for your inspiration, my walk is not as interesting or beautiful as yours, but enjoyed it all the same. Enjoy the rest of your day. Love and Hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Loving all these lovely pics, managed my first long walk with the dog in weeks,  haven’t had any energy, didn’t realise how tired I would feel, chemo has a lot to answer for.  Its a small world I live in Coventry didn’t realise how many of you live around this area, the locks are lovely. hopefully will manage to take some pictures on my next walk. love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Finally managed to upload photos, Lovely walk in the woods just down the road from me, nice to see all the wild flowers coming out. Just loving the sunshine, makes you feel so much better. Jenny xx Seems they have disappeared will try again later xx,
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning ladies, don’t think I will be walking much today we have torrential rain. have a red robin tree in my garden had it 8 years and for the first time it has flowers on it, didn’t know they flowered, but it is really pretty. Jenny x x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: That's more exciting than ours, we had cod fish cakes with a lovely salad, followed by fresh fruit and yoghurt, but we are out for lunch tomorrow so be having something delicious no doubt xx
Posts.Title: What a difference

Posts.Content: Welcome kathleen37 sorry you find yourself here, but we are a friendly bunch, there is always someone with an answer to most questions, try not to use Dr google, it’s doest always have the most updated information. There is plenty of support, laughs and hugs on here, so don’t be afraid to rant, cry or moan, we are all here for you. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Hello!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Imelda, I was only thinking the same thing when I read a post about someone ringing the bell after finishing treatment. I am totally in agreement with you I definately think we should have a bell, it’s a lovely unit and definately needs a bell. I am 100% behind you xx love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Hi, never thought of that would make a great t shirt, might try and make it into a cross stitch picture too xxxx
Posts.Title: To all you lovely ladies out there.

Posts.Content: Had my 1st rads today, after weeks of waiting I am on the final countdown, good luck to those starting chemo, you can do it, we can kick cancers butt, see you Thursday Littlesusie when you start, love and hugs to everyone xx
Posts.Title: Finally started radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thought this was very appropriate xx
Posts.Title: To all you lovely ladies out there.

Posts.Content: Hi , I had mine done under general too no problems home same day, it was brilliant used  it for my chemo on Friday and was so much better than struggling to find a vein. Don't worry it's an easy procedure and no problems after , hope all goes well for you xx
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Best feeling ever, I know this is the last bit, thanks for the tip on letting the air to it, will do but def won't be going topless to the shops xxx
Posts.Title: Finally started radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Just brilliant xxxx
Posts.Title: Music Fans : pics to bring a smile :-)

Posts.Content: Hi I was given emend to take before chemo and 2 days after, also ondansatron and domperidone  and intravenously before chemo, it worked for me, never had any sickness or nausea, think it's just trial and error, our hospital was very good they give you everything so think I was very lucky, sending love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: That awful nausea!

Posts.Content: I totally agree there are much better ways of raising money, It is 4 years since I lost my hair, and it was nearly a year before it grew back, and my hair has never been the same  thick and curly like it was, in fact my hair is so thin and fine you can see my scalp, my eyebrows and eyelashes are hardy visible, and hardly any body hair.  Anyone doing brave the shave wants to seriously think again, do something better, “take a walk in my shoes”, maybe then you would think differently. love and hugs Jenny. xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Morning I was advised to use E45 and I am nearly finished my rads and I am a bit sore but they keep an eye on you, and they have now given me special creams and gels to help xxx
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: You can do this Aliowl, sending lots of love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Morning Ali, this gift just keeps on giving, my nails were awful, they never actually fell off but they peeled so much there was hardly anything there, I used flexitol nail and cuticle cream got it on amazon, and it really helped they are growing nicely now and look so much better, Littlesusie also said she was using nu nail cream from boots or Amazon and that had helped hers, it's a nightmare we go through chemo rads etc and then the side effects hit us, when will it end, I have now developed Lymphodema in my arm and boob, so that's driving me mad, we just want to get back to " normal " or something like it. my hair is growing quite well, but not long enough to do anything with, so sticks up in all peculiar angles, he ho , sending you live and hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: neddys/moaning cows club !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Aliowl, well done you have done your first one, hope the side effects aren’t too bad, I have just finished my 8th month of chemo tablets, back next week to hopefully start my next one. How many have you got to have, and what are you having this time, let’s hope they treat you well. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi all, I flew twice to lanzarote while on tamoxifen, I was told to wear compression socks and take 75 mg aspirin daily 2 days before and while I was there and stop after I got back. Had no problems at all xx love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: got to agree, the help you get is wonderful, everyone is so lovely and made some lovely cyber friends, thanks everyone xxx
Posts.Title: This is the best BC forum!

Posts.Content: Judyr58, I was thinking the same thing, why she was on the site is she hasn’t had breast  cancer, I know some people don’t loose their hair with chemo, but there are loads and loads who do and feel exactly the way we do. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Can’t find it there are so many Tebs
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, you are not alone my face has got lots of fine hair on it too, had lumpectomy, chemo and rads, but no herceptin, and have been on tamoxifen, since April, I was told that it is doesn't last long and not to shave it, and it will hopefully disappear, think lots of people got this when their hair grows back, and your body adjusts to the after effects of chemo, " the gift that keeps on giving "  please do not apologise for winging we all get down days, and we are all here to help each other, take care love and hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: I'm growing a hairy,furry face!!!

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies,I have had 2 weekly taxol and find my stomach is really bloated, is this normal, and has anyone any ideas to help reduce it, thanks ladies xxx
Posts.Title: Bloating and taxol

Posts.Content: Morning Ali, merry Xmas to you too, my tea fairy is still snoring his head off, might have to give him a few prods in a minute. hope you enjoyed your tea and have wonderful Christmas xxxx
Posts.Title: happy xmas eve lovely ladies !!!

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear your chemo has been cancelled, at least on the plus side you can enjoy Christmas, I am 11 days after my 4th fec and still feeling rough and ulcers in my mouth to top it all, hoping they clear up in time for Christmas lunch, it will be the first one I haven't cooked in well I can't remember, my lovely daughters are cooking it, can't wait sending hugs and enjoy your Christmas xxxx
Posts.Title: Disappointed

Posts.Content: I had a port fitted before Christmas it was sore at first but it it didn't take long to settle down, having my 2nd chemo with it today, the first was brilliant, take some pain killers to help, if you are still worried I suggest you contact your bcn and have a word, hopefully it will settle down, wishing you well xxxx
Posts.Title: port painful?

Posts.Content: Hi kacang, love them they are gorgeous. Love Jenn xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hope these give you an idea x love and hugs  Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Edwina, Have been on and posted some pics, but haven’t been doing much sewing lately as this chemo is making me feel so tired, I can’t seem to find the energy to do much, have got a new cross stitch just need to start it. Hope you are ok xx Here are a couple I did for my youngest grandchildren, I have done one for all 7 grandchildren, all different xx love Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Tigermum, what a lovely picture, is it cross stitch or tapestry, it must have taken hours of work. I am currently doing a cross stitch of garden birds and am nearly there. It definately takes your mind off any troubles. Well done love it. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Thanks Tigermum, found it you have some wonderful pieces on there. Xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56 wow That is lovely, that must have taken ages, well done x love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Cannon,  Absolutely love it, well done it’s unique. Love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: What a lovely idea, I love to knit, crochet and do cross stitch. I find it helps me relax, I did lots of tiny baby clothes for the local neonatal unit during my chemo, and have carried on, I have just finished a blanket and cardigans for my daughters friends baby. Also my latest cross stitch. Hope you got on ok with your pic line. love and hugs to everyone. Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi ladies if you click on the link you can download the patterns. https://www.knittedknockers.org/make-a-knocker/ Hope you enjoy. Love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, loving all these lovely pictures, what a lot of different talents. Thought I would show you the toys I did for Christmas.  Have a a lovely day ladies, keep posting pictures it is an inspiration to see them all xx love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi cannon, Is this what you need. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Tigermum, your house sounds just like mine, have run out of space to put them. I just love doing them, i always do counted cross stitch, and prefer 32 count evenweave material, but very rarely buy kits, just charts now as I have boxes of threads, and most kits come with 14 count Aida which I don’t use, so I have loads of Aida if any one wants it. You will have to send me a link to your blog it would be lovely to see your pictures xx love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, looks lovely Cannon, I am sure you will enjoy doing it. Thought I would post a photo of my favourite cross stitch a lovely keepsake of my grandchildren. Love Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Love him too, we have a pesky grey squirrel that keeps pinching the bird food, he even managed to get a big suet block off the tree and run off with it. Would much prefer your Filbert he is gorgeous. Love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Edwina, love them they are so cute. Love this thread too so many lovely talented ladies, keep posting pics they are lovely to see. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Love it xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Snuggles10, Love your pics, they are all fab, love the hedgehog and Christmas puds, It’s so nice to see everyone’s crafts. Love Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Frances, Love the doggie coats, thanks for the tip about woolwarehouse, just had a look on their site such a huge choice, not too far from me so worth a visit. Also the free pattern site, is that where you got the dog coats from, I have loads of spare wool, so good way to use it up xxx Love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Thanks, I know the feeling, I have made so many covered with sequins all sewn on one by one with a bead on each one, all very small sequins too, all had to be different,I dread to think how many I made, I made them for 12 years, some competition they would need anything up to 6 different ones each. Really loved it though, my youngest daughter skated for 10 years, saved me a fortune making them for her too jenny xx.
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Tigermum, I love cross stitch, my house has loads on the walls, many are really large, but I love doing them, All my grandchildren have birth samplers, and have done loads for friends, but my passion is the old fashion ladies in beautiful, flowing dresses, which have tiny beads as well as cross stitch, i can forget about the world around me when I am doing them. will post a picture of the birds when when I finish it. these are a couple of the ladies I have done. Have a nice day, love and hugs, Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Finally finished and framed my latest cross stitch, ready to start my next one now, Keep posting your pictures they really are an inspiration. Love and hugs .Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Tigermum, That looks lovely, can’t wait to see it finished. Love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Wow they are so cute, happy knitting ladies xxx Love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Well done Cathy he is lovely, it has been quiet on here, everyone must be out walking!!!, haven't done much for a bit, have a cross stitch on the go, but don’t seem to find the time to finish it, did manage some baby cardigans and blanket for the new baby next door but that is as much as I have done, need to get my mojo back and finish my cross stitch. love Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, thanks, glad you finally got your date, not long to wait then, lot easier than chemo, the end is in sight. Love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Hi ronstar, What a lovely idea, love it. Love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Morning all on this beautiful day, just had my last radiotherapy, and feel fantastic, it's been a long year, some hard some easy, but I made it, thanks to the love and support of my family and friends, and also all the lovely friends I have met on here. For those just starting out on your journey, it's not an easy ride but you can do it, stay strong, love and hugs to you all xxx this is me and Littlesusie on our final week of radiotherapy xxx
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Thanks Cathy will have a look xx Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Loving all these pics, haven’t felt well enough to do much lately, but pre cancer I made leotards for the local skating club, had to make my own patterns, couldn’t do it now, but do miss it.     Keep looking at the cross stitch I started really need to finish it, need to get motivated again. love Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Love her Cathy, where do you get your patterns from they are really cute, must get my cross stitch out again, need to finish it. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC
I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Brilliant news xxx
Posts.Title: Result of first mammogram today ...

Posts.Content: Just watched this, and must say it was really nice to see a programme that puts a positive view on breast cancer, I have secondary breast cancer and found it really showed how far treatment has come, and gives you hope for all these new drugs that are being developed.  I have been given one of these new drugs and so far I have had positive results, and it is helping to control my cancer. well done BBC. love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: BBC Scotland Beaston Cancer Centre - Episode One Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Morning Susie, glad things are on the move, I have some hair fuzz too bit patchy on head, but my Grandaughter assures me I have tiny eyelashes and eyebrows, we are getting there, have a lovely day see you tomorrow in rads xxxx
Posts.Title: Hair coming back

Posts.Content: Welcome Tiy, sorry you find yourself here, but you will find we are a friendly bunch, I don’t know how I would get through everything without the support on here, you can show your true feelings on here and get all the help and support you need, and of course plenty of hugs x
Posts.Title: New Here

Posts.Content: Good morning to you from a very wet Coventry too, got my 5th rads today, sending love and hugs to all having treatment xxxx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Hi KEM63, I have breast lymphodema,  and was given kenisio tape it is brilliant. I tried the massage but it didn’t help, have a word with your breast care nurse and get an appointment with the lymphodema nurse, they will help you. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Breast lympodema

Posts.Content: Thanks Ali, hope you are feeling a bit better, not long now and you will be finished, hope the last one will be kind to you, take care xxxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, I have never felt the cold before, but just lately I have been cold all the time too must be a chemo thing, I do eat but never fancy much as everything tastes rubbish my mouth tastes awful all the time, even drinks taste horrible, all my favourites can't even stomach, just can't wait to get my taste buds back roll on the end of chemo hope you are ok, how's the new car xxxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Hi Avril, I had taste problems with fec but nothing like what I am having on weekly taxol, my mouth is constantly tasting awful, everything I try to eat tastes the same awful, food I loved before can't even stomach, even my ginger biscuits,  can't wait to finish so I can finally taste and enjoy my food, wouldn't mind even though my appetite is poor I still put weight on with the taxol, nightmare, think we just have to put up with it, think how lovely food will taste when we finish xxxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: We are supposed to be going out for a meal with friends tomorrow, don't know how i will get on with that, got oncologist tomorrow, should have been today but got a phonecall to say he is on holiday and its been changed to tomorrow, so not even sure if I am seeing the prof or not, hope you enjoy your weekend, and your new car xxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Hi Avril, hope you are ok, just got back from meal out, and surprisingly I tasted it, first time in ages, and enjoyed it too, but got chemo tomorrow so be back to horrible tastes again, can't wait to finish chemo so it all tastes nice again, just keep telling myself it won't last forever xx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Remember those big knickers too, like Susie said the stuff they gave me drove me mad too, think it was the dressings, so just used what I had, did blister but I am sure it was the stuff they gave me, once I stopped that it got better, stick to the aloe Vera and doublebase, xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I agree makes you think doesn't it, crying too xx
Posts.Title: Sometimes I Wonder

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Kathy hope you have had a good day, love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I am 65 and still think I am a youngster, till I try getting out of bed in the morning, and my body tells me otherwise, and as you say Joyce at least we can hand the Grandchildren back. Kathy and Susie definitely need to go out and celebrate again, especially now you are well on the way to finishing your rads Kathy. Love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I got oral thrush on fec and had nystatin and worked really well for me, my oncologist makes sure I have a supply of nystatin with each chemo now in case, but I have now changed to taxol and so far not had thrush, hope yours clears up soon,xxx
Posts.Title: Oral thrush side effect of chemo

Posts.Content: Well done kathy on finishing your rads, hope you enjoy your drink, well done Susie on your weight loss, I have managed to loose the weight I put on during chemo, and am now back to my weight before all this, thought I would put more on with the tamoxifen but I havnt, so let's hope it stays that way, think we need to celebrate kathy finishing treatment when I get back from my holiday ladies xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, you will be fine, it's so much easier than chemo and only takes about 15 mins, it will fly by, mine did, make sure you put plenty of cream on to keep it moist xxx
Posts.Title: I've had a brilliant day!

Posts.Content: Skin is not too bad, bit red and sometimes feels hot, but not sore, keep putting the cream on though, see Breast care nurse in 2 weeks to check it, who are you seeing in July, I see the prof on 12th August xx
Posts.Title: I've had a brilliant day!

Posts.Content: hi,Ali, not long now till you start your rads, hope all goes well xxxx
Posts.Title: I've had a brilliant day!

Posts.Content: Sounds like you have been busy, it's a great feeling just to do normal things, grandchildren have been over, so ive had a good weekend too, and the thought of no more rads is even better, enjoy your few days in London, and then roll on afternoon tea at Coombe Abbey xxx
Posts.Title: I've had a brilliant day!

Posts.Content: Thanks Carol and Ali, will try them. Have b&m recently opened  right by me  xxx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: I've been today Ali, didn't have any Turkish delight thins this time, but plenty of other choc goodies, plus took my 3yr old grandaughter, and always buy far more than we need but what the heck, we deserve it xx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: All these chocs sound lovely, never heard of Turkish delight thins, who makes them, love all chocolate but have to be careful as they give me migrains, but saying that for some reason since I have had chemo that hasn't happened, so bring on the chocs xxx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: Those macaroons look so yummy Judith, making my mouth water just looking at them,  xxx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: That's the problem with b&m, they have recently opened this one it was homebase, and is only about 150 yds from my house, and right by the hospital, so it is far too easy just to pop in to see what's on offer, must say I don't miss homebase, xx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, not doing too bad , I go every Friday morning for my chemo, we seem destined not to meet, have my look good feel good on Tuesday afternoon, we went to Ansty hall hotel in Ansty for lunch the meal and service was fantastic, and my taste buds behaved so I could really enjoy it, can't wait to finish my chemo and my tastes get back to normal, if all goes well my last chemo is 20th March, and then radiotherapy, maybe we will be the same time , if not we will have to meet for coffee xxx
Posts.Title: It's Sunday

Posts.Content: Will do , and definitely think we should make it a special treat xx
Posts.Title: It's Sunday

Posts.Content: You can buy Dimples products online from a place called "simply wigs" xx
Posts.Title: Nice smelling wig shampoo/conditioner

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, your lunch sounds lovely, I have had the best day ever, been really spoilt and taken out for a surprise meal at a posh hotel, with all the family to celebrate my birthday, just nice to feel normal for once xxx
Posts.Title: It's Sunday

Posts.Content: Hi I'm fairly new on here too, but everyone is so helpful, someone has an answer for your every question, and the support is fantastic, I have just had my 2nd fec chemo on Friday, and apart from the headaches once again, it didn't seem so bad as the first, although tiredness is still a problem, but we get through it, I have a fantastic husband, 3 daughters, and wonderful friends who are helping me, and I am sure your sister will feel the same, she has you by her side. I won't say it's easy, but it's doable, every day is a new day, try to stay positive and just be there for her ups and downs. Love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: breast cancer newbie

Posts.Content: Hi I had really bad headaches for my first 3 fec chemos but am fine now and am on taxol now and have not had any xx
Posts.Title: headaches

Posts.Content: Welcome to the group no one wants to join  Love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: Thanks Ali, can't believe it's finally here it's been a long 6 months, had highs and lows, mainly lows, but have got here, hope your last one hasn't been too bad, love and hugs to you too xxx
Posts.Title: LAST CHEMO YAYYYYY

Posts.Content: my gorgeous dog Milly who we lost a couple of weeks ago, with her best friend my Grandaughter.
Posts.Title: Dogs (man's best friends)

Posts.Content: “Be Strong enough to stand alone, Smart enough to know when you need help, and Brave enough to ask for it.” love and hugs Jenny xxx

Posts.Content: Love that Ali, love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Content: Wise words Ali,  me too. Love and hugs Jenny xxx

Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: “If today all you can do is hold yourself together, be proud of yourself” love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, hope you are ok, I am doing ok, got over my traumatic hospital appointment, weather is a bit hot for me though, so just sitting on my garden swing in the shade, managed a walk with the dog early this morning before it got too hot. When are you finding out what chemo you are on, hope it all goes well. Love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Content: “ I am not what I have done, I am what I have  overcome. “ Love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Love and hugs Jenny xxx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Thanks Ali, my usual oncologist was away so saw some young smarmy upstart, who insisted my bloods were too low to have my chemo, and he would reduce my dose and delay it for a week, in the end they did another blood test and sent me home, he was so awful I had a real meltdown at the hospital. The nurse who was with me was lovely and said that I would be fine she would ring me later, she did, my bloods were absolutely fine which I knew they would be, he was so arrogant I shall be having a word next time I go and will refuse to see him again. so I had to go back and pick up my normal chemo tablets and the dose would be the same, I was none too pleased, I knew he was wrong he probably looked at the wrong results, I have the blood tests weekly through each cycle. It was so hot too which didn’t help. Sorry for the rant. Hope you get your appointment soon. They don’t rush do they, the waiting is the worst bit. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, sorry you are having a hard time with work, it amazes me how many employers are awful to cancer patients, it’s not as if we choose to have cancer. I am sure they would think different if it was them, some have no sympathy at all. Glad you won’t have much longer to wait for your oncology appointment, hope they are kind to you. love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: “People don’t always need advice, sometimes all they really need is a hand to hold, an ear to listen, and a heart to understand them.” love and hugs Jenny xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: “You were given this life because you’re strong enough to live it.” love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Content: Love and hugs Jenny xxx

Posts.Content: Morning all, ”Every day may not be a good one, but there is good in every day.” Love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Content: Fine today thanks Ali, have a good day. love Jenny xx

Posts.Content: Bustysusy,Bonbonlarue’s daughter posted about 9 months ago to say her mum had deteriorated and gone into end of life care. love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Content: Hi ali owl, hope you are doing ok with your first chemo, I am feeling ok, back for bloods tomorrow, then  injections and see oncologist tues, hopefully start my 9th course of chemo. Mammogram in August, feel as if I live at the hospital, good job I only live over the road, Take care, lots of love and hugs Jenny xx

Posts.Title: So true x

Posts.Content: Can't believe we are nearly at the end of our chemo, it seemed so daunting when we started in Oct, and now here we are a month away from finishing, can't wait xxx
Posts.Title: Look good, feel better

Posts.Content: Hi I took the steri strips off in the shower after they took the dressing off it was much easier, it's amazing how bad the smell is. I used to think people must smell me, but they said they never did. I used sensitive baby wipes and dove pure roll on deodorant and that helped, in fact I still use it now 3 months down the line xxx
Posts.Title: Talcum Powder

Posts.Content: Got one on mine too, 31 days 12 hrs 39 minutes, not that I am counting  !!!!, but still got 5 chemos as mine are weekly, but sounds good to me xxx
Posts.Title: Look good, feel better

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, glad you enjoyed it, and as you say the goody bag is brilliant, hope you are feelng ok, we are getting there, how is your face now, is it tomorrow you see Prof Poole, make sure you take plenty of supplies you will be there for ages, last time I saw him my appointment was 9.30 and didn't see him till gone 12. So good luck, will be thinking of you xxxx
Posts.Title: Look good, feel better

Posts.Content: Was next wed but changed to 9.45 on 4th March, at least it is in the morning, but as you say, you definitely get all the time you need with him, he never rushes you. Hope all goes well, he did say on my last visit, he would book my radiotherapy this time, let me know if he books yours xxx
Posts.Title: Look good, feel better

Posts.Content: Classic, made me smile too xxx
Posts.Title: Bad hair day

Posts.Content: Brilliant, only way is up xx
Posts.Title: An exciting day!

Posts.Content: Hi Ali and Susie, can't believe we are finally at the end, it's been i long journey, hope you are feeling a bit better Ali, good luck Susie for tomorrow, I agree that I have met some lovely friends on here too, and in the night hours when you can't sleep there is always someone awake to talk too. Love and hugs Jenny xxxx
Posts.Title: littlesusie and Jenny lara !!!

Posts.Content: Well done Susie, love the photo, we can now celebrate in style xxx
Posts.Title: I did it too!

Posts.Content: I was on tamoxifen for 2years, and had awful side effects, after lengthy talks with my oncologist; who is a professor told me he would give me a break to see what happens, he said it can take up to 6 months to get out of the system, as it sits in your fat. Don’t worry about being off it for 6 Weeks, there will still be plenty in your system. I have now been put on Toremifene and so far not had the horrendous joint pain, but time will tell. Hope you get sorted, sending love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Is there an alternative to Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I finished chemo in March, and rads last week, but ever since finishing chemo, my knees have been really painful too, also the soles of my feet sore, was told by Dr that it was normal for some people after chemo, and should eventually go, so I live in hope xxx
Posts.Title: dodgy knees

Posts.Content: hi ladies, just found we have a " like " button, loving it, it's lovely to be able to say you like someone's post, hope you all have a good day, love an hugs to you all, xxx
Posts.Title: " like " button

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, hope all went well with your injection this morning, hope you don't suffer to much, like you I feel I spend all my time at the hospital, back again tomorrow for my tattoos ready for radiotherapy.  And then next wed, having a general to take my portacath out, on the plus side next week I am looking forward to meeting Littlesusie for afternoon tea, love and hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: " like " button

Posts.Content: I wasn't told not to eat anything, and like Susie ate eggs all through my chemo x
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: Morning ladies, was just thinking the same, missing them too hope all is well,xxxx
Posts.Title: G n j

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, hope you are ok, last time I got the shakes my temp shot up to 39.1 and I ended up in hospital, have you taken your temp, if it's ok might just be a reaction to your chemo, this blasted chemo has a lot to answer to, take care sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: propa got shakes today !!!

Posts.Content: Morning Ali, hope you are doing ok, it's just on the left under the post at the bottom, above the alert message  xxx

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well for you today Ali and you don't feel too bad after. I am off to meet the radiotheray consultant today and tomorrow get my little dots tattooed, then hopefully soon get to start radiotherapy, have a good day xxxx

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear you are not well, sending hugs and get well wishes for a speedy recovery xxxx

Posts.Content: Well here it is 2015, wishing you all a better year, thanks for all the support on here, especially George, keep up the good work. To all those new ladies, you can do this we are all in this together, stay strong love to you all xxxxx
